title: MIA Representatives Participated in the 3rd Reporter Training Held by CARNOCTravelandtourworld.com
text:
MIA Representatives Participated in the 3rd Reporter Training Held by CARNOC
With the emerging and rising of new media, such as flight delays, civil aviation security problem have been more and more concerned by the society, news of civil aviation has become the focus of public. Practitioners of civil aviation publicity and public relations are facing more severe tests. In order to further enhance the ability of news covering and writing and guiding network public opinion, it is better to make full use of new media. Representatives of Macao International Airport (MIA) participated in the 3rd Reporter Training Program held by CARNOC (largest civil aviation portal in China) in Lijiang, Yunnan from 15 to 19 September 2015.
The training excavated aviation news by courses and practice, such as how to select topics and publicize aviation news, how to deal with network public opinion crisis in the age of new media. The participants communicated with each other through this activity.
Representatives of MIA participated in the training are: Macau International Airport Co., Ltd. (CAM) – Assistant Manager of Marketing Department Mr. Daniel Lam, Officer of Corporate Communication & Policy Research Office Ms. Miley Kou; Administration of Airports Ltd. (ADA) – Senior Public Relations Supervisor – Ms. Angel Leong, Customer Services Officer Ms. Cherie Chan; Airport Information Management Solutions (AIMS) –Assistant Manager of Finance & Administration Department Mr. Kim Wong.
Source:- Macau International Airport
